entry.title: Canada announces open work-permit for tech workers and digital nomads
entry.content: Canada has launched its first-ever Tech Talent Strategy to attract top talent in high-growth industries and fuel innovation. The strategy includes measures such as open work permits for H-1B visa holders, employer-specific work permits for highly talented individuals, and improvements to the Start-up Visa Program. [summary] [comments]

entry.title: OpenOrca: open source dataset and instruct-tuned LLMs
entry.content: OpenOrca is an open-source dataset and instruct-tuned LLMs project that aims to replicate the efforts of Microsoft's Orca project. The dataset includes 3.5 million instructs from the ChatGPT dataset, and OpenOrca-LLaMA-13b is expected to be released in mid-July 2023. [summary] [comments]

entry.title: XGen-7B, a new 7B foundational model trained on up to 8K length for 1.5T tokens
entry.content: We trained a series of 7B LLMs named XGen-7B with standard dense attention on up to 8K sequence length for up to 1.5T tokens. XGen-7B achieves comparable or better results than state-of-the-art open-source LLMs of similar model size. XGen-7B performs well in both text and code tasks. [summary] [comments]

entry.title: Writing Python Like Rust
entry.content: The author discusses their experience of working on a Python project and borrowing tricks from Rust and Go. They highlight the benefits of type checking, the use of dataclasses, and the approach to error handling in Rust. They also mention the limitations of Python's enums and express their preference for Rust's richer enums and pattern matching. Additionally, they praise the pathlib library for its similarity to Rust's Path. [summary] [comments]

entry.title: Future CSS: State Container Queries
entry.content: The Chromium team is experimenting with a new type of query called State Query, which allows us to check if an element is stuck or if a flex container is wrapped. This feature would be useful for updating the design or functionality of elements based on their state. [summary] [comments]

entry.title: The Comprehensive Guide to Elixir's List Comprehension (2022)
entry.content: The for special form, also known as a list comprehension, is a construct designed for concise and powerful enumerable transformation in Elixir. It looks very similar to a ‚Äúfor loop‚Äù in other languages like JavaScript and C, but rather than being a language construct, it is an expression (like everything else in Elixir). [summary] [comments]

entry.title: Visa to acquire Brazilian startup Pismo for $1B
entry.content: Visa has agreed to acquire Brazilian startup Pismo for $1 billion in cash. The acquisition will allow Visa to provide core banking and issuer processing capabilities, as well as support for emerging payment rails like Pix in Brazil. [summary] [comments]

entry.title: I made a command-line tool to assist me with writing polyrhythmic drum parts
entry.content: Polyrhythmically-inclinded Midi Drum generator. Contribute to dredozubov/polyrhythmix development by creating an account on GitHub. [summary] [comments]

entry.title: Honda Monkey Breaks World Record Covering 4,183 Km on Single Tank
entry.content: Acerbis has set a new Guinness World Record for the greatest distance ridden on a single tank of fuel by a gas-powered motorcycle. They covered an impressive 4,183.8 kilometers (2,599.7 miles) without refueling. [summary] [comments]

entry.title: Junk websites filled w AI-generated text pulling in money from programmatic ads
entry.content: AI chatbots are being used to generate text for junk websites that attract paying advertisers. Over 140 major brands are unknowingly advertising on these unreliable AI-written sites, with Google serving 90% of the ads. This practice not only threatens the internet with spammy AI-generated content but also wastes billions of dollars in ad money. [summary] [comments]

entry.title: Launch HN: June (YC W21) ‚Äì Product Analytics for B2B SaaS Companies
entry.content: Two and a half years ago, the founders left their jobs at Intercom to build a startup. After learning the differences between product analytics for B2C and B2B, they pivoted their company to focus on building a product analytics tool for B2B SaaS companies. Now, over a thousand B2B SaaS companies at seed and Series A use their product every month. [summary] [comments]

entry.title: Zygomys: Embedded Scripting Language for Go
entry.content: Zygo is a Lisp interpreter written in 100% Go. It allows for dynamically composing Go struct trees in a zygo script and invoking compiled Go functions on those trees, making Go reflection easy. [summary] [comments]

entry.title: How to make your scientific data accessible, discoverable and useful
entry.content: Miguel Acevedo faced challenges in combining his research data on malaria in lizards with his colleague's older data due to inconsistencies in data format and standards. Metadata, which describe data, are crucial for making data findable, accessible, interoperable, and reusable. Scientists should include metadata in a 'README' file that provides details about data collection, processing, and variables. Raw data and derived data should be shared if possible, but if storage is an issue, publishing the data used to generate figures is recommended. Data should be archived in open, non-proprietary file formats and code should be shared alongside the data. [summary] [comments]

entry.title: Show HN: Litnerd (YC S21) ‚Äì Kids Book Club Meets Gaming
entry.content: Litnerd is an online reading club program for kids that combines book club with gaming. It offers weekly live meetups, movie adaptations, music, reading courseware, mini lessons, and reading tournaments to make reading a lifelong habit. [summary] [comments]

entry.title: The idea maze for AI startups (2015)
entry.content: An ‚Äúidea maze‚Äù is a map of all the key decisions and tradeoffs that startups in a given space need to make. A good founder is capable of anticipating which turns lead to treasure and which lead to certain death. A bad founder is just running to the entrance of (say) the ‚Äúmovies/music/filesharing/P2P‚Äù maze or the ‚Äúphotosharing‚Äù maze without any sense for the history of the industry, the players in the maze, the casualties of the past, and the technologies that are likely to move walls and change assumptions. I thought it would be interesting to show an example of an idea maze for an area that I‚Äôm interested in: AI startups. Here‚Äôs a sketch of the maze. [summary] [comments]

entry.title: Construct's New WebGPU Renderer
entry.content: After years of work, Construct is proud to introduce its all-new WebGPU renderer. This upgrade brings significant improvements and better performance compared to the existing WebGL renderer. The WebGPU renderer is based on modern graphics APIs like Vulkan, Metal, and DirectX 12, and it supersedes WebGL. [summary] [comments]

entry.title: PayPal ‚ÄúBuy Now‚Äù buttons have been broken for a week
entry.content: PayPal broke their Buy Now buttons for customers who sell electronic goods. The error is because they use eval() in their JavaScript, which browsers block. [summary] [comments]
